aws::graph::propositions: # Pasadena Police Department Heliport Accident Information
Heliport requires replacement of hooded light figures with flush green perimeter lights according to FAA AC 150/5390-2C.
Heliport requires marking of the FATO in accordance with AC 150-5390-2C figures 2-22 and 2-23.
Heliport requires removal of all helicopter parking spot markings.
Heliport requires redesign of the parking plan according to AC 150-5390-2C, paragraph 214, table 2-1, and figures 2-17 and 2-18.
Pasadena Police Department made heliport upgrades after the accident.
Pasadena Police Department conducted an internal review after the accident.
Pasadena Police Department reviewed and updated their standard operating procedures manual.
Pasadena Police Department heliport upgrades included new lighting.
Pasadena Police Department heliport upgrades included new markings.
Pasadena Police Department heliport upgrades included new pad assignments.
Pasadena Police Department heliport upgrades included obstruction clearance.
Pasadena Police Department heliport upgrades included tree removal.
Pasadena Police Department heliport upgrades included ground obstacle removal.
Pasadena Police Department heliport upgrades included procedural review.
Pasadena Police Department increased safety/section meetings for timely identification and response to issues.
Pasadena Police Department continued emphasis on factory and local flight training.
Pasadena Police Department increased ground and flight training for Tactical Flight Officers (TFOs).
Pasadena Police Department improved section training library for personal development.
Pasadena Police Department resolved irrigation issues associated with flight line drainage.
Pasadena Police Department conducted table top exercises related to lost aircraft/aircraft accident.
Pasadena Police Department increased ride checks with pilots and TFOs to ensure compliance with established procedures.
The pilot held a Commercial certificate.
The pilot did not have Airplane Rating(s).
The pilot had Helicopter Rating(s).
The pilot did not have Instrument Rating(s).
The pilot did not have Instructor Rating(s).
The pilot had Class 2 Medical Certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot was an Occupational Pilot.
The pilot had an estimated 16200 hours of total flight time in all aircraft.
The pilot had an estimated 8000 hours of total flight time in this make and model.
The pilot was 49 years old.
The pilot was female.
The pilot occupied the right seat.
The pilot's restraint use was unknown.
There was no second pilot present.
Toxicology was not performed on the pilot.
The pilot's last FAA medical exam was on June 6, 2012.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on July 11, 2011.

text:
# Page 8 of 22

## Heliport Upgrades

1. Replace hooded light figures with flush green perimeter lights in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) AC 150/5390-2C, Heliport Design, paragraph 216.

2. Mark the FATO in accordance with AC 150-5390-2C figures 2-22 and 2-23.

3. Remove all helicopter parking spot markings, and redesign the heliport parking plan in accordance with AC 150-5390-2C, paragraph 214, table 2-1, and figures 2-17 and 2-18.

## OTHER INFORMATION

As a result of the accident, along with their own internal review, the Pasadena Police Department made several heliport upgrades and procedural changes:

* Reviewed and updated their standard operating procedures manual
* Heliport upgrades included new lighting, markings, pad assignments, obstruction clearance, tree removal, ground obstacle removal, and procedural review
* Increased safety/section meetings for timely identification and response to issues
* Continued emphasis on factory and local flight training
* Increased ground and flight training for TFO's
* Improved section training library for personal development
* Resolved irrigation issues associated with flight line drainage
* Conducted table top exercises related to lost aircraft/aircraft accident
* Increased ride checks with pilots and TFO's to insure compliance with established procedures

## Pilot Information

| | |
|-|-|
| Certificate: | Commercial |
| Airplane Rating(s): | None |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | Helicopter |
| Instrument Rating(s): | None |
| Instructor Rating(s): | None |
| Medical Certification: | Class 2 With waivers/limitations |
| Occupational Pilot: | Yes |
| Flight Time: | (Estimated) 16200 hours (Total, all aircraft), 8000 hours (Total, this make and model) |
| Age: | 49,Female |
| Seat Occupied: | Right |
| Restraint Used: | Unknown |
| Second Pilot Present: | No |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Last FAA Medical Exam: | June 6, 2012 |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | July 11, 2011 |
